00011 /** @file */

00013 #ifndef __AFCGI_H__
00014 #define __AFCGI_H__
00015 
00016 #include <events.h>
00017 #include <rotbuffer.h>
00018 
00019 #define AFCGI_VERSION 1
00020 #define AFCGI_HEADER_LEN  8
00021 #define AFCGI_BUFFER_SIZE (1<<16)
00022 
00023 /** The names of the different callbacks */
00024 enum afcgi_callback_names {
00025         /** Called when all headers was received */
00026         ON_HEADERS = 0,
00027         /** Called when STDIN stream packet was ready */
00028         ON_RECEIVE,
00029         /** Called when DATA stream packet was ready */
00030         ON_DATA_RECV,
00031         /** Called when all STDIN packets was sent */
00032         ON_RUN,
00033         /** Called when all DATA packets was sent */
00034         ON_END_OF_DATA,
00035         /** Called when application can write on STDIN, STDERR */
00036         ON_WRITE,
00037         /** Called when server sent abort */
00038         ON_ABORT
00039 };
00040 
00041 /** return status */
00042 enum afcgi_return_status {
00043         /** normal end of request. */
00044         AFCGI_REQUEST_COMPLETE = 0,
00045 
00046         /** 
00047          * rejecting a new request. This happens when a Web server sends concurrent
00048          * requests over one connection to an application that is designed to
00049          * process one request at a time per connection.
00050          */
00051         AFCGI_CANT_MPX_CONN    = 1,
00052 
00053         /**
00054          * rejecting a new request. This happens when the application runs out of
00055          * some resource, e.g. database connections.
00056          */
00057         AFCGI_OVERLOADED       = 2,
00058 
00059         /**
00060          * rejecting a new request. This happens when the Web server has
00061          * specified a role that is unknown to the application.
00062          */
00063         AFCGI_UNKNOWN_ROLE     = 3
00064 };
00065 
00066 struct afcgi_sess;
00067 struct afcgi;
00068 
00069 /** 
00070  * used for standard afcgi callbacks
00071  * @param s   is afcgi session
00072  * @param arg is easy argument
00073  */
00074 typedef void (*afcgi_cb)(struct afcgi_sess *s, void *arg);
00075 
00076 /** 
00077  * used for standard afcgi input callbacks
00078  * @param s    is afcgi session
00079  * @param arg  is easy argument
00080  * @param len  is data length
00081  */
00082 typedef void (*afcgi_cb_data)(struct afcgi_sess *s, void *arg,
00083                               int len);
00084 
00085 struct afcgi_hdr {
00086         char *name;
00087         int name_len;
00088         char *value;
00089         int value_len;
00090         struct afcgi_hdr *next;
00091 };
00092 
00093 struct afcgi_sess {
00094         uint16_t request_id;
00095         struct {
00096                 uint16_t role;
00097                 uint8_t  flags;
00098                 uint8_t  reserved[5];
00099         } h;
00100         char *head;
00101         struct afcgi_hdr *hdr;
00102         enum afcgi_return_status return_status;
00103         int rc;
00104 
00105         // call backs
00106         void *arg;
00107         afcgi_cb on_headers;
00108         afcgi_cb_data on_receive;
00109         afcgi_cb_data on_data_recv;
00110         afcgi_cb on_end_of_data;
00111         afcgi_cb on_run;
00112         afcgi_cb on_abort;
00113         afcgi_cb_data on_write;
00114 
00115         // links
00116         struct afcgi *afcgi;
00117         struct afcgi_sess *write_next;
00118         struct afcgi_sess *write_prev;
00119         struct afcgi_sess *end_next;
00120 };
00121 
00122 struct afcgi {
00123         int fd;
00124         int s;
00125         struct { // current header
00126                 uint8_t  version;
00127                 uint8_t  type;
00128                 uint16_t request_id;
00129                 uint16_t content_len;
00130                 uint8_t  padding_len;
00131                 uint8_t  reserved;
00132         } c;
00133         char *head;
00134         struct afcgi_binder *binder;
00135         struct afcgi_sess *sess[AFCGI_BUFFER_SIZE];
00136 
00137         // read
00138         char buffer[AFCGI_BUFFER_SIZE];
00139         char *buff;
00140         int buff_len;
00141 
00142         // write
00143         struct afcgi_sess *write;
00144         struct rotbuffer buff_wr;
00145         char buffer_write[AFCGI_BUFFER_SIZE];
00146 
00147         // end
00148         struct afcgi_sess *end;
00149 };
00150 
00151 struct afcgi_binder {
00152         int fd;
00153         void *arg;
00154         afcgi_cb on_new;
00155 };
00156 
00157 /**
00158  * init fcgi internals and poller system
00159  * @param maxconn The maximun of connection expected (all sockets)
00160  *                -1: use the max limit (ulimit -n)
00161  *                >0: use this value, ans set limit
00162  * @param tm      The timeout tree pointer from lib events
00163  */
00164 void afcgi_init(int maxconn, struct ev_timeout_basic_node *tm);
00165 
00166 /**
00167  * Bind network address or socket 
00168  * @param bind   network address or socket (or NULL for stdin)
00169  * @param on_new callback called for new connexion
00170  * @param arg    easy arg 
00171  * @return if ok return 0, else return < 0
00172  */
00173 int afcgi_bind(char *bind, afcgi_cb on_new, void *arg);
00174 
00175 /**
00176  * afcgi main loop. This launched the main loop after initialization
00177  * @param loop (boolean) 0: the function return,
00178  *                       1: the function never return
00179  */
00180 void afcgi_loop(int loop);

00182 /**
00183  * set easy argument
00184  * @param s fascgi session identifier
00185  * @param arg easy argument
00186  */
00187 static inline void afcgi_set_arg(struct afcgi_sess *s, void *arg) { s->arg = arg; }

00189 /**
00190  * set callback
00191  * @param sess fascgi session identifier
00192  * @param name callback name
00193  * @param cb calback pointer
00194  */
00195 #define afcgi_set_callback(sess, name, cb) afcgi_set_cb_ ## name(sess, cb)
00196 
00197 static inline void 
00198 afcgi_set_cb_ON_HEADERS(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb cb) {
00199         s->on_headers = cb;
00200 }
00201 static inline void 
00202 afcgi_set_cb_ON_RECEIVE(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb_data cb) {
00203         s->on_receive = cb;
00204 }
00205 static inline void 
00206 afcgi_set_cb_ON_DATA_RECV(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb_data cb) {
00207         s->on_receive = cb;
00208 }
00209 static inline void 
00210 afcgi_set_cb_ON_WRITE(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb_data cb) {
00211         s->on_write = cb;
00212 }
00213 static inline void 
00214 afcgi_set_cb_ON_RUN(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb cb) {
00215         s->on_run = cb;
00216 }
00217 static inline void 
00218 afcgi_set_cb_ON_END_OF_DATA(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb cb) {
00219         s->on_end_of_data = cb;
00220 }
00221 static inline void 
00222 afcgi_set_cb_ON_ABORT(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb cb) {
00223         s->on_abort = cb;
00224 }

00226 /**
00227  * search header
00228  * @param s afcgi session identifier
00229  * @param name header name (case insensitive
00230  * @return header if found, NULL if not found
00231  */
00232 static inline struct afcgi_sess *
00233 afcgi_search_header(struct afcgi_sess *s, char *name) {
00234         struct afcgi_hdr *h;
00235 
00236         h = s->hdr;
00237         while (h != NULL)
00238                 if(strcasecmp(name, h->name) == 0)
00239                         return h;
00240         return NULL;
00241 }
00242 
00243 /**
00244  * search header, return string format
00245  * @param s afcgi session identifier
00246  * @param name header name (case insensitive
00247  * @return char *header if found, NULL if not found
00248  */
00249 static inline char *
00250 afcgi_search_header_str(struct afcgi_sess *s, char *name) {
00251         struct afcgi_hdr *h;
00252 
00253         h = afcgi_search_header(s, name);
00254         if (h == NULL)
00255                 return NULL;
00256         return h->value;
00257 }
00258 
00259 /**
00260  * afcgi session want's write
00261  * @param s afcgi session identifier
00262  */
00263 void afcgi_want_write(struct afcgi_sess *s);
00264 
00265 /**
00266  * afcgi session do not write more
00267  * @param s afcgi session identifier
00268  */
00269 void afcgi_stop_write(struct afcgi_sess *s);
00270 
00271 /**
00272  * write data
00273  * @param s afcgi session identifier
00274  * @param buff buffer
00275  * @param len buffer len
00276  * @return size writed
00277  */
00278 static inline int afcgi_write(struct afcgi_sess *s, char *buff, int len) {
00279         return rotbuffer_read_buff(&s->afcgi->buff_wr, buff, len);
00280 }
00281 
00282 /**
00283  * afcgi session end
00284  * @param s afcgi session identifier
00285  * @param rs return status
00286  */
00287 void afcgi_end(struct afcgi_sess *s, enum afcgi_return_status rs, int rc);
